intro: Mallotus sanchezii, commonly known as the Sanche's mallot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
